settings.title: Settings
item.sqldungeons.ku_next.desc: A scroll that tells you the next SQL clause.
item.sqldungeons.having.desc: One-time use spell for post-aggregation filtering.
item.sqldungeons.consumable_having.desc: A consumable that grants one-time HAVING usage.
dungeon.floor1.title: Tutorial 1: Show everything with SELECT
dungeon.floor1.story: Type the spell `SELECT * FROM table001` into the editor and execute it.
dungeon.floor2.title: Tutorial 2: Select specific columns
dungeon.floor2.story: Use `SELECT (column) FROM (table)` to display specific columns. Check the conceptual schema for the table name and retrieve the `message` column.
dungeon.floor3.title: Tutorial 3: Filter with WHERE
dungeon.floor3.story: Use `SELECT ... FROM ... WHERE (condition)` to filter rows. From the `fruits` table, display `name` and `color` where `color = 'Red'`. Conditions look like `column = 'value'`. You can also use <, >, <=, >=, <>.
dungeon.floor4.title: Tutorial 4: Sort with ORDER BY
dungeon.floor4.story: Use `ORDER BY (column) [ASC|DESC]` to sort results. From the `fruits` table, show `name` and `price` ordered by `price` ascending. `ORDER BY id` sorts by `id` ascending; ASC is the default, use DESC for descending.
dungeon.floor5.title: Tutorial 5: Aggregate with GROUP BY
dungeon.floor5.story: Use `SELECT ... FROM ... GROUP BY (column)` to group rows. From `fruits`, count how many fruits there are per `color`. Aggregation functions include COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX. `COUNT(*)` counts rows, e.g. `SELECT color, COUNT(*) FROM fruits`.
dungeon.floor6.title: Beginner SELECT
dungeon.floor6.story: The dungeon entrance. From `products`, find all items with `price >= 1000` and display `name` and `price`.
dungeon.floor6.hint: Use a `WHERE` clause to filter rows that meet specific conditions.
dungeon.floor7.title: GROUP BY Challenge
dungeon.floor7.story: A monster lair. Count monsters per `species` from the `monsters` table.
dungeon.floor7.hint: Use `GROUP BY` to aggregate per group.
dungeon.floor8.title: INNER JOIN Spell
dungeon.floor8.story: In the guild hall. Join `employees` and `departments` and list each employee's `emp_name` and `dept_name`.
dungeon.floor8.hint: Use `INNER JOIN ... ON ...` to connect tables by a common column.
dungeon.floor9.title: Find affordable fruits
dungeon.floor9.story: From the fruits table, display name and price for rows where price < 150.
dungeon.floor9.hint: Use a WHERE clause to filter rows by price.
dungeon.floor10.title: Retrieve a message
dungeon.floor10.story: From table001, fetch the message for the row where id = 2.
dungeon.floor10.hint: To target a specific row, use the primary key in a WHERE clause like `WHERE id = 2`.
dungeon.floor11.title: Filter by product category
dungeon.floor11.story: From products, display name and price where category = 'æ­¦å™¨'.
dungeon.floor11.hint: Use WHERE category = 'æ­¦å™¨' to select only products of a specific category.
dungeon.floor12.title: Filter monsters by HP
dungeon.floor12.story: From monsters, display name and hp for rows where hp > 20.
dungeon.floor12.hint: Use numeric comparisons like > and < to filter by HP.
dungeon.floor13.title: Join and filter by department
dungeon.floor13.story: Inner join employees and departments, then show emp_name and dept_name where departments.dept_name = 'é–‹ç™ºéƒ¨'.
dungeon.floor13.hint: Combine JOIN and WHERE to filter after joining.
dungeon.floor14.title: Group and filter by count
dungeon.floor14.story: Group fruits by color and show groups having COUNT(*) > 1.
dungeon.floor14.hint: Use GROUP BY with HAVING to filter aggregated results.
dungeon.floor15.title: Find affordable fruits
dungeon.floor15.story: From the fruits table, display name and price for rows where price < 150.
dungeon.floor15.hint: Use a WHERE clause to filter rows by price.
dungeon.floor16.title: Find employees with big sales
dungeon.floor16.story: Select emp_name from employees where emp_id IN (SELECT emp_id FROM sales WHERE quantity > 5).
dungeon.floor16.hint: Use IN with a subquery to relate rows between tables.
dungeon.floor17.title: Department sales totals
dungeon.floor17.story: Join sales, employees, and departments and show SUM(quantity) grouped by dept_name.
dungeon.floor17.hint: Use JOIN combined with GROUP BY to aggregate per department.
dungeon.floor18.title: Date-filtered aggregation
dungeon.floor18.story: For sales before 2025-02-01, show SUM(quantity) per dept_name.
dungeon.floor18.hint: Be mindful of date formats when comparing dates as strings.
dungeon.floor19.title: Filter after aggregation with HAVING
dungeon.floor19.story: Aggregate sales since 2025-02-01 by department and show only those with SUM(quantity) > 5.
dungeon.floor19.hint: HAVING applies conditions to grouped results.
dungeon.floor20.title: Final Trial: Department sales filter
dungeon.floor20.story: Join three tables, filter by date (>= '2025-02-01'), group by dept_name and show departments with SUM(quantity) >= 10.
dungeon.floor20.hint: Join 3 tables, filter by date with WHERE, aggregate with GROUP BY, and finalize with HAVING!
sql.keyword.select.desc: Basic clause to select columns from a table.
sql.keyword.from.desc: Specifies the table to retrieve data from.
sql.keyword.where.desc: Filters rows based on a condition.
sql.keyword.by.desc: Specifies keys for grouping or sorting.
sql.keyword.on.desc: Specifies the condition for joining tables.
sql.keyword.as.desc: Gives an alias to a column or table.
sql.keyword.sum.desc: An aggregate function that calculates the total.
sql.keyword.avg.desc: An aggregate function that calculates the average.
sql.keyword.min.desc: An aggregate function that returns the minimum value.
sql.keyword.max.desc: An aggregate function that returns the maximum value.
sql.keyword.count.desc: An aggregate function that counts rows.
sql.keyword.in.desc: Checks if a value is in a given set.
